title: How to Assign Multiple IPs to a Single Network Interface in Linux
description:
The concept of creating or configuring multiple IP addresses on a single network interface is called IP aliasing, which is very useful for setting up multiple virtual sites on a web server using one single network interface with different IP addresses on a single subnet network. In this guide, learn how to create multiple IP […]

The post How to Assign Multiple IPs to a Single Network Interface in Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
